text_block_list.name: Monologue
text_block_list.text:
The Kikuka Sho, the final race of the<n>Classic
Triple Crown, is before us. The<n>crowd roars in
anticipation of the drama<n>that will unfold.

text_block_list.name: Monologue
text_block_list.text:
Symboli Rudolf, meanwhile, merely waits<n>in
silence.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
Conventional wisdom holds that the<n>Kikuka Sho
goes to the strongest<n>Umamusume.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
A 3,000-meter course with two uphill<n>stretches is
apt to test any racer's mental<n>fortitude.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
It demands speed, stamina, and<n>technique in
equal measure. Only an<n>Umamusume who excels
in every area<n>can hope to win the day.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
If I were to cede that crown to another, I<n>could
hardly presume to call myself<n>Emperor.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
But as thanks for your faith in me, allow<n>me to be
your escort.

text_block_list.name: Symboli Rudolf
text_block_list.text:
Come with me, Trainer... and we shall<n>see the
highest of heights together.
